dynamics.note: Low crest factor - metal is heavily compressed

frequency.note: VERY BRIGHT - different baseline than studio rock

stereo.note: Good stereo image - solid L/R separation

dynamics.note: Improved CF, expanded DR by 23.2 dB

stereo.note: NARROWED for punch - tighter phase relationship

loudness_changes.interpretation: Most aggressive RMS reduction of all genres - creates headroom

dynamics_changes.interpretation: Significant improvement - recovers dynamics from compressed original

frequency_changes.interpretation: UNIQUE: Treble reduction (opposite of other genres), aggressive midrange reduction for clarity

stereo_changes.interpretation: Stereo NARROWED (opposite of bootleg) - more focused, punchy presentation

metal_characteristics.baseline_brightness: VERY BRIGHT (1344 Hz vs rock 664 Hz)
metal_characteristics.root_cause: Professional metal mixing is aggressive and punchy from the start

matchering_approach.assessment: Matchering enhanced metal's aggressive character while improving technical quality

key_findings: Metal original is BRIGHT (1344 Hz centroid) - opposite of dark bootleg
Matchering reduces treble (-1.22 dB) - opposite of brightening other genres
Bass boost (+3.85 dB) similar to bootleg but for different reason (punch vs correction)
Midrange reduction (-5.70 dB) is most aggressive of all genres analyzed
RMS reduction (-3.93 dB) most extreme - creates significant headroom
Dynamic range expansion (+23.2 dB) similar to bootleg - suggest compressed originals
Stereo narrowing (-0.155) opposite of bootleg widening (0.21) - genre-specific approach
Metal mastering is about punch and aggression, not clarity and presence

implications_for_auralis.important_note: Metal genre requires THIRD mastering approach - not just studio or bootleg

key_moves.approach: Enhance aggressive character while improving quality

key_insights.discovery: Metal is bright, not dark - needs treble REDUCTION not boost
key_insights.implication: Can't use one EQ curve for all genres

key_insights.discovery: Bass boost can be for correction (bootleg -4) or enhancement (metal +3.85)
key_insights.implication: Can't just boost bass - need to understand why and how much
key_insights.auralis_action: Different bass boost amounts for different recording types

key_insights.discovery: Stereo processing is opposite: bootleg expands, metal narrows
key_insights.auralis_action: Detect stereo width, apply appropriate adjustment

key_insights.discovery: RMS reduction in metal is most extreme (-3.93 dB)
key_insights.implication: Metal originals are over-compressed - need aggressive headroom creation
key_insights.auralis_action: Metal preset allows more RMS reduction than other types

key_insights.discovery: Midrange reduction in metal is most aggressive (-5.70 dB)
key_insights.implication: Metal needs clarity through aggressive mid reduction
key_insights.auralis_action: Metal midrange target: -5.7 dB (vs studio -1.0, bootleg -3.85)

metal_preset_specification.notes: Most aggressive parameters of all genres. Unique treble reduction. Strong midrange removal. Significant RMS reduction for headroom.

preliminary_detection.logic: If all criteria met, classify as METAL

metal_detection_criteria.note: Iron Maiden is single metal reference - more references recommended for robust detection
